message.content:
cs.AR, cs.PF, cs.PL, cs.DC, cs.SE 

The paper focuses on optimizing the performance of OpenCL workloads on diverse architectures by characterizing memory access patterns. This involves analyzing program features and metrics to understand and predict program performance on arbitrary hardware architectures. The paper also proposes a new metric of parallel spatial locality to better understand memory access patterns affecting efficiency across architectures. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AR (Architecture), cs.PF (Performance), cs.PL (Programming Languages), cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), and cs.SE (Software Engineering).
